list.comment:
My creative process begins with drawing inspiration from flavors, textures, and nature. It could be the color of an heirloom tomato, the satisfying *crunch* of the top of a creme brûlée, or the sweet and herbal flavor of caramelized fennel—I try to be ready whenever inspiration strikes. For this delicious chocolate and coffee mousse, I drew inspiration from the spiced notes + silkiness of @nespresso's new #MasterOrigin Mexico coffee.
.
For me, craftsmanship and creativity go hand in hand. Craftsmanship means doing more than just creating, it's doing your best to create the highest quality result with the utmost care and respect for the art of the craft, and every person + object involved. 🎨
.
As a creative and a storyteller I have a lot of respect for those who are passionate about what they do and take the time to perfect their craft. An exemplary example of this is @nespresso, and their new #MasterOrigin line of coffees readily speaks to this. Their Mexico #MasterOrigin coffee involves blending both medium-roasted Arabica and deeply-roasted Robusta beans. Like grape varietals with winemaking, blending different varieties of coffee beans is an art that creates incredible flavor variations.
.
The Robusta variety has a particularly sticky fruit, and requires a delicate double wash and soak to clean the beans completely, which is why it's a rare variety that isn't used as often due to the extra care it requires to get the best possible flavor from every single bean. This kind of attention to detail shows the love and dedication to perfection that goes into every cup of @nespresso, and you can taste the difference in each sip. I highly recommend giving this *incredibly* flavorful and delicious new coffee a try! If you need me, I'll be alternating between sipping @nespresso and enjoying this mousse 😆 #NespressoTastemakers
.
.
.
.
.
#coffeeculture #coffeeoftheday #coffeesesh #cupsinframe #howiseemycoffee #igcoffee #instacoffee

list.comment:
It's Friday, friends!!! I'm heading to Long Island, New York today to help @table_culture get things ready for our first-ever east coast @oursecretsupper! 😆
.
I can't wait to meet all our incredible guests and share the beautiful location we have in store with them. You can follow along on my Instagram stories tomorrow for all the supper behind-the-scenes prep! 🍽
.
P.S. If you're curious about this bread, I have some woven bread recipes up on the blog archives at AdventuresInCooking.com 😋 Highly recommend hopping over and taking a peek!!
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

It's raining outside, and that means another little peek at this comforting Hungarian mushroom soup from the blog archives! 🍲 It's full of umami-rich mushroom flavor, a touch of tangy sour cream, loadsssss of paprika, and bright + herbal fresh dill. You can find the recipe link in my instagram stories + in the recipe archives at AdventuresInCooking.com!
.
I love getting creating with cooking and styling dishes, but one of my favorite aspects of working with photography and food is the editing process. 👩🏻‍🎨 There's just sooooooo much potential in each image, and I love how with a few clicks of a button you can breathe new life into an image.
.
This photo was edited with the 'General - Striking Grey' preset from my 'Dark + Moody' preset collection. I also have a limited edition preset pack right now that's geared towards the color palette of fall and winter. You can take a peek via the link in profile, and use THANKFUL25 for 25% off until EOD tomorrow! Hope you enjoy them, friends!!
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

A look at one of my favorite shops here in Portland, @appetiteshop. During the holidays I always #ShopSmall with @AmericanExpress, and gifting plants from this beautiful local store is one of my favorite ways to share the love and support small businesses. #ad
.
Growing up in my parents' Greek deli taught me the importance of small business within a community, and how it can bring people together and offer them services and a level of local understanding that big chain stores and online giants just don't have. It also ingrained in me how much these small businesses care for their customers, and how incredibly hard they work to be there for the community.
.
So this small business Saturday, come together and shop small in your own city. Your town, your community, and your gift recipients will thank you! #amexambassador
.
.
.
.
.

.
I'll be sharing it on the blog early next week along with a Thanksgiving menu including my favorite seasonal dishes, and @oursecretsupper will have a guide to making your Thanksgiving table settings look awesome with ease! Stay tuned, friends!! 😆
.

Happy Halloween, friends! It's based off of the Gaelic holiday Samhain, which celebrates the end of the harvest season and the beginning of the darker cold months. In many cultures, it's also thought that this is the time when the connection between the world of the living and the world of those we've lost is strongest, hence the 'spooky' elements of the holiday. 🔮
.
Regardless of what you believe, I hope you all enjoyed these last few days of October and soak up as much of the autumn harvest as you can. I'm talking pumpkin soup, apple cider, pecan bars, and all that tasty stuff! 🍏
.
If you are celebrating Halloween, I wish you a wonderful holiday filled with tasty treats, some not-too-scary tricks, and adorable trick-or-treaters at your door. And if you haven't gotten your candy yet, consider this your friendly reminder. Nobody likes the grumpy old neighbor who leaves their lights off with no bowl of candy on their doorstep! 👻
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

Leftovers are best made into pasta, in my opinion. Just a reminder the recipe for this turkey tetrazzini is currently up on the blog, and ready for you to put your Thanksgiving leftovers to use!
.
I'm always a bit sluggish about getting back to work after a long holiday weekend, but find that looking forward to a a tasty lunch and dinner is the best motivation to get moving. Now, I'm going to try to dig myself out from a pile of emails, shoot some photos for a client, set up the light in the chicken coop to see if I can get them to lay a little this winter, and check if the yellow jackets are still bothering the beehive...life's pretty weird, guys. 😆
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

Thinking back to this beautiful view from our #FirstWeEat workshop home in Glengarriff. I've been thinking a lot about next year's workshops, and am feeling so inspired about diving in deep and creating meaningful learning experiences for attendees both new and previous. 🌟
.
I'll be hosting a workshop next year that's just for advanced level photographer's and creatives, and is geared towards folks who have already taken one of my workshops or online courses and want to build on what they've already learned. 👩🏻‍🎓 I'm so excited to put together a whole new workshop format + activities for it, it's going to be such a blast!
.
I'll be sending out a survey in the next couple weeks to those of you that I've already taught to see what kinds of topics or activities you'd like to learn about or experience as a part of the advanced level course, so keep your eyes on your inbox if this applies to you! Can't wait to hear your thoughts!! 😘
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

Working on bringing a little holiday cheer to the blog in the form of these bread wreaths, coming at you Friday! 🎄 In addition to these guys, I've also been hard at work putting together the creative mastermind I'm hosting in 2019. All your feedback about what you'd like to learn about was so incredibly helpful, and I've structured it to hit on all those notes! ⭐️
.
Being a part of the creative community for a decade has shown me how important collaboration is, and how helpful it is to get outside opinions and advice. I am *so* excited to create a space where women in the creative field can be honest about what their struggling with, lift each other up with advice and insight, and achieve big goals in 2019.
.
If you've attended one of my workshops or my online courses, you know how much I love teaching (🤓), so that will be incorporated into it, too! Plus a couple in-person workshops just for the mastermind group. It's going to be really, really incredible to work with the same group of women all year. ✨
.
If this sounds like your jam, you can sign up to be notified via the link in profile when registration opens. ☝🏼 I'd love for you to send me a message, too, letting me know that you're interested! ✍🏼
.
Wishing you all a wonderful rest of your Wednesday!!! 🧡
.
.
.
.
.

.
Its base consists of sautéed wild mushrooms, loads of paprika, dill, and a bit of sour cream for that signature Hungarian creaminess. You can find the recipe via the link in profile! ☝🏼

After all of the weekend's feasting, I hope you don't mind a *very* close look at some butterscotch-covered pumpkin pie. 🤩
.
We've been plowing through those turkey leftovers, and tomorrow we're going to work it off by carrying around a Christmas tree from the nursery.
.
Yep, we're getting our tree in a pot still alive and very plant-able! We'll keep it in the house until Christmas, and then afterwards we'll transplant it outside at the homestead. Eventually we'll have a little holiday forest out there with trees from every Christmas past. I'm really excited to start this new tradition! 🌲
.
Do you have any special holiday traditions? I'd love to hear them!!
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

I'm spending today getting prepared for Thanksgiving, which means roasting pump for the pie, making and freezing the pie crust, getting a tart crust ready, and double checking that I bought all the ingredients for my cornbread and braised cabbages.
.
I'm also going to attempt to catch up on some house and yard work (chicken coop, I'm looking at you.) It definitely won't be fun cleaning out the coop with gale-force winds, but the girls deserve a cozy nesting space on Thanksgiving. 🐓🐔🐓
.
Wishing you all lots of luck with you food preparation today! And if you need any last-minute ideas, I have a Thanksgiving menu with recipes up via the link in profile and AdventuresInCooking.com 🍂
.

So excited for Thanksgiving next week!!!! If you're looking for a good turkey recipe, I highly recommend the pear-glazed turkey in the recipe archives at Adventuresincooking.com 🍗🙌🏼😋
.
It's the only recipe I make whenever I prepare a turkey, and I always get rave reviews on how juicy and flavorful it is. The recipe on the blog provides you with the turkey, stuffing, a glaze, and pan-drippin' gravy so you'll end up with quite the spread! 🙌🏼
.
I also highly recommend bringing your bird, which I detail in the recipe. Brining the bird deposits salt crystals in the bird, and salt soaks up and holds onto moisture (like when you sprinkle salt on raw veggies to draw the moisture out). The salt crystals that remain in the bird after brining hold onto moisture and keep it in the bird as it's cooking. Salt also helps break down protein, so it also tenderizes the bird, which is especially helpful in parts like the breast which can get a little gamey if over-cooked.
.
I hope this info helps ecourage you to give brining a try, I can't recommend it highly enough!! 🦃
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

Last night we had a real crazy wind blow through my town, and I kept waking up to the sound of all the big douglas fir trees creaking around our house 👀
.
Everything stayed intact and upright, though, so we're all good! Now I'm just tackling a lot of sedentary computer work that I need to catch up on. Being stuck in front of a computer for hours is my least-favorite thing to do, I'd much rather be outside clearing the garden for the season and putting away the drip watering system. I like to get my hands dirty 😬
.
But, sometimes when you're an adult you have to do boring things that you don't thoroughly enjoy, so that you can have moments where you *do* get to do the fun stuff. For me, fun stuff means cooking, too! 🍳 The tasty breakfast in this photo is my favorite Dutch baby of all time, a big ol' savory mushroom n' herb pancake. You can find the recipe in the blog archives via the link in profile! ☝🏼
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

Sometimes inspiration and motivation seem just out of reach. A couple months ago I was grappling with a period of staleness, where I was having an incredibly difficult time creating. I was bored with my own style and work, and felt uninspired in general.
.
The idea of thinking something to cook and style and shoot and write about seemed simultaneously overwhelming and uninteresting. I was having a "meh" moment about my creative work as a whole.
.
This happens to even the best of us—every creative I know struggles with getting stuck in their comfort zone, which eventually leads to boredom and a lack of inspiration overall. The good thing is that those types of feelings comes in waves, and while sometimes the wave can seem like an insurmountable 150 foot tall one, like all waves it too will pass.
.
This Saturday morning I'm sending out an email talking more in depth about this struggle, and the ways I learned to overcome creative stagnation. You can sign up for my mailing list via the link in profile to learn more about breaking out of your creative comfort zone ☝🏼
.
It's so important to address these struggles that we all have and share—no one is inspired and creating magic 24/7, and learning to cope with those periods of frustration and lack of motivation is a key part of being a functioning creative. I hope this helps y'all and let's you know that you're not alone in your creative strife! 💚
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

The most beautiful library I've ever seen, at Trinity College in Dublin. It's a long, narrow building with two stories of bookshelves on either side, and dark wood paneling as far as the eye can see. Every shelf is heavy with old books, full of stories, histories, and adventures.
.
Libraries are my favorite buildings, there's just something magical + enchanting about them. All that potential tucked away in each page. Knowledge, inspiration, entertainment...books can change your whole world and you don't even have to leave the room.
.
As a little girl, I read obsessively. My mom could always tell if I was reading past my bedtime by the light coming through under my bedroom door, so I'd turn off my light when I knew she was going to bed, wait until I heard her walk to my parents bedroom, and then turn my light back on again and read until I fell asleep with a book on my chest.
.
In college, I worked all four years at the campus library. I loved being on the hidden "other" side of it where all the books were sorted and organized as the new shipments of texts came in. The smell of freshly printed pages was almost as wonderful as the friendly musty smell of the old ones.
.
As an adult, I read much, *much* less than I did as a kid, and that's a real bummer. I've set a goal for myself to read 1 book a month starting this winter, and I'm open to suggestions! I tend to love fiction thrillers + mysteries, and non-fiction books about plants, animals, and history, but am pretty open to anything. I'm all ears, friends!
.
.
.
.
.
.
#librarylife #finditstyleit #smallspacesquad #diywin #homerenovation #interiordesign #modernhome #cottagestyle #oldhouselove #interior123 #librarydesign #library #bookshelf #mycanonstory #cntraveler #huffposttravel #lonelyplanet

Autumn is my favorite time of year. There's just something unspeakably beautiful about seeing all the trees' leaves change colors to the most vibrant yellow and orange hues. Walking through the woods the past few weeks has been incredible—being bombarded with neon gold and ochre and crimson from all sides leaves me a little breathless and truly in awe of the natural world. 🍁🙌🏽🍂
.
As the trees take their time to go dormant during the winter season, I think it's important that we all take a cue from them and give ourselves a little break. Allow yourself to relax a little more. Give yourself time away from tv and electronics and tons of social outings. Let yourself be bored.
.
You get some amazing thoughts + ideas when you're bored, but in this era of constant stimulation the human mind doesn't get to wander as often, and that's a shame. Part of why I love hiking + wandering outside so much is that it gives me a chance to focus on something physical, the natural world around me, and allows my mind to just relax and enjoy the moment. And sometimes I end up with pretty good ideas after the walk, too! 🤓
.
If you have a moment, I highly recommend giving yourself a little 'boredom' time this week. Whether that means sitting inside with a hot cup of tea, or going on a walk outside and leaving your phone behind, give yourself + your mind a little chance to reflect and wander. Life's too short not to pause and enjoy it from time to time. 💚
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

Sharing my favorite Thanksgiving menu dishes up on the blog today! One of them is my go-to turkey recipe, which involves a glaze made from wine, honey, butter, and sage, and being roasted in a pan surrounded by pears. 🍐🍗🍐 It's pretttttty amazing, guys, and is a Thanksgiving staple at our place. You can see the post via the link in my profile! ☝🏼
.
@Oursecretsupper is also sharing a post from our fun collaboration, and she's sharing the best tips for decorating your holiday table in a quick, easy, and beautiful way. 🍁🍂🍁 You can check them out via the link in her profile, too!
.
Wishing you all the best of luck in the final stretches before Thanksgiving. Today is a good day to get all that grocery shopping done if you haven't tackled it yet (i.e. that's what I plan on doing right after I post this!) Can't wait to see all the beautiful meals everyone shares on Thursday! 😆
.
.
.

Can't believe the northeast @oursecretsupper was a week ago—time flies!! @whatscookingoodlooking_ made these delicious local clams with jalapeno butter as one of the appetizers when our guests first arrived, and they were as tasty as they sounded! 🐚😋
.
@table_culture is holding them in her lovely @prherbfarm apron, the garden store + greenhouse was a such a perfect place to host the supper and stay nice and cozy during the wet autumn weather.
.
It's supposed to be overcast today back home in the pacific northwest, too, but I'll be staying inside most of the morning taking a local fishing class, then venturing out in the afternoon to put it into practice. Wish me luck, and stay dry, friends!!! 🎣
.
.
.

Just spent the most incredible 24 hours watching chefs from all over the world compete at the @BarillaUS #PastaWorldChampionship here in Milan, Italy. #ad The ingenuity each chef brought to the table was truly inspiring, it's amazing to see the way pasta ignites + fuels everyone's creativity, resulting in such a bounty of delicious and unique dishes. 🙌🏼 From zucchini flowers to bottarga to wild mushrooms, the chefs covered it all!
.
I loved seeing the coastal Mediterranean influence on many of the key ingredients used in the competition, too. 💚 Pasta is such an important part of the mediterranean culture, as is the sea, and watching the way the chefs incorporated local ingredients like langoustine, squid ink, and sea urchin made me very happy (and hungry!) 😋
.
The dish featured here is a @BarillaUS mezze maniche rigate pasta with tuna, squid ink, and bottarga. It's from Chef Diaz of @terzopianochicago—she's representing the US and won her competition today in round 3, WOOHOO! I am SO excited to see her compete tomorrow, the positivity and energy she brings to the kitchen is incredible to watch. You can follow along with all the behind-the-scenes today + tomorrow on my instagram stories—see you soon, friends! 🍝
.
.
.
.
.
.
#firstweeat #mycommontable #eatlocal #farmfresh #locavore #foodoftheday #cookingtime #fromscratch #pasta #pastalover #pastapasta #italianfood

Sharing the recipe for this Pumpkin Pie with Butterscotch up on the blog today, as well as a WHOOOOOLE new look for Adventures In Cooking! 🌿 I've had an online home at AdventuresInCooking.com for almost 9 years now, and I definitely wasn't keeping up with any sort of organization or ease-of-use for most of that time. 😬
.
Now, though, I've been working with @lindsay_humes since May to create a beautiful, simple, and accessible new online home for all my recipes and adventures, and I am SOOOOOO happy to be able to share it with you guys today! 😆🌟😆
.
It has an amazing new search window, a super organized recipe index, and lots of old posts have been updated with keywords so that you can actually find them when you're searching through the site. (With 488 published blog posts on the site, this wasn't a simple job, so a huuuuge thanks to @sofiabrancokraft for helping with this tedious task! 🙏🏼)
.

I got home from another trip on Sunday night, and this time I'll be staying put for a few months. I can't tell you how good it feels to sleep in my own bed knowing that I'll get to stay there for a good, long while. I love traveling and making new friends and seeing new places, but there truly is no place like home. 🏡
.
Routine, family, being able to cook good food everyday instead of eating out on the road...these are the things that keep me grounded and make me happy. I'm really excited to be able to relish them this winter while I hibernate and start putting together the structure for the Mastermind I'm hosting next year for creatives. 💡 If you're intrigued, shoot me a message or sign up for my email list via the link in profile, I'll send you a head's up when it's closer to opening (likely around December).
.
I've also been working on a little housekeeping at AdventuresInCooking.com with @lindsay_humes, and am *soooo* excited to share it with you guys next week! It's been in the works since May, and I can't wait to finally be able to share it with you and hear your thoughts! 🤩
.
Now I'm off to a day of shooting photos for the new site layout and meeting with the lovely @sofiabrancokraft for a tasty lunch, wishing you all a lovely autumn day! 🍂🧡🍁
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

A glimpse at this weekend's @oursecretsupper at @prherbfarm herbfarm with @whatscookingoodlooking_. We had a realllll blustery storm blow in for the day, but the greenhouse kept us nice and cozy and our incredible + adventurous guests arrived in spades. It was so amazing getting to meet all the wonderful people who came from all over the east coast to join us at our very first #SecretSupper there! It definitely won't be the last 💚🌿💚
.
Huge thanks to my co-host @table_culture for making all this magic happen, to @whatscookingoodlooking_ for creating so many delicious autumnal farm-to-table dishes for us, to the enchanted @prherbfarm for sharing their magical and lush farm with us, and to our amazing volunteers @bottegastories @_jeanettegenson @wongfeifeinyc @cakes8 for working like crazy, laughing with us, and creating such an incredible experience. 🙏🏼
.
And the deepest thanks to our sponsors @smithteamaker and @arusticaffairnyc for donating their delicious tea + beautiful tables + chairs (respectively) to help make this gathering a reality. Will be sharing more images from the supper in the coming weeks, so stay tuned! 🙌🏼

When I was 11 years old, gun violence affected me for the very first time. My family had a Greek deli growing up, and my dad was closing up for the night alone when three men came and asked to use the restroom. They robbed him at gunpoint, left, he called my mom who called the police, and then the men came back, realizing they left a witness behind. They told him to get down on his knees, they pointed the gun at his mouth, and they pulled the trigger.
.
My dad lost 1/3 of his blood by the time the paramedics arrived. We arrived at the hospital later that night, and got to visit him in the ICU. As a little girl, my dad was my hero—he was the strongest, biggest, toughest man I knew. Seeing him lying there with tubes coming in and out from all over him, unable to move or speak, with machines all around beeping and whirring, was the worst feeling I've ever experienced in my life. It was soul crushing.
.
He was a miracle, though. The bullet shattered his jaw, exited his soft pallet, didn't hit his tongue (which could have made it impossible for him to speak again), and landed on his collar bone where it stayed put. This type of bullet was made to shatter upon impact to inflict the most damage, but miraculously it did not. My dad recovered and is alive and well to this day.
.
Unfortunately, my story is not unique. Thousands of other American families live this hell every year.
.
Why?
.
Gun violence should NOT be an acceptable part of our culture.
.
I am begging you, PLEASE vote for someone who will stand up to the NRA + make a policy change. Do not vote for the spineless cowards who have chosen to line their pockets with blood money from the NRA rather than to protect American citizens with the modernized gun regulations we so desperately need.
.
This is literally a matter of life and death for ALL of us. If that doesn't motivate you to vote, what will?
.
If not now, WHEN?
.
If not you, WHO?
.
.
#saynotofascism #voteblue #ivoted #fckyesimvoting

#ad Doing a little Shopping Cart dance to help raise awareness for the AMAZING @NakedJuice Drink Good Do Good campaign that's addressing the fruit + vegetable accessibility crisis in the United States. Nearly 30 million Americans don’t have access to affordable, quality, fresh fruits and vegetables. It’s an issue affecting nearly one out of every 10 people across the country, and one of the saddest parts is that 60% of Americans don’t actually believe this problem exists in their own community (hint, it definitely does!)
.
Through the annual Drink Good Do Good campaign, @NakedJuice partners with @WholesomeWave to help increase access to affordable, quality, fresh fruits and vegetables. To build more awareness, this year’s campaign is asking consumers to fill their carts for good by doing The Shopping Cart dance — everyone’s favorite old-school dance move.
.
**For every Shopping Cart dance video, Boomerang or photo posted or shared with #FillYourCartForGood on Instagram, Twitter or Facebook, Naked will donate the monetary equivalent of a cart of produce to communities in need.** So get down, get funky, and do The Shopping Cart dance to #FillYourCartForGood! Together we can make change happen ❤️

Thinking back to when everything in the garden was green and lush and growing, and these hop vines were producing the cutest little hops dangling off the archway I made from salvaged branches from around the yard.
.
I had intended to make a hop cordial but then got so caught up preserving all the tomatoes that it completely slipped my mind! Next year though, I'll make it happen. 🌿🙌🏼
.
Now the garden looks very brown (and a little gold) and is in dire need of autumn tending. The wind has blown this archway over a bit, so that needs to be re-structured, and all the old tomato plants need to be pulled and composted. Plus the drip watering system need to be put away before the water inside it freezes. ❄️
.
We're going to dive into tackling all that on Friday, really hoping the winds die down by then! They've been so biting and cold lately that it's been kind of painful to be outside at our place haha. Wish us luck!! 💚
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

I'm settling into fall today. For me, this is a time of reflection, nesting, and sorting. I get a moment to sit and think about what I *really* want and need to do, and then go about putting little things in their places, writing things that need to be written, and generally organizing everything I neglected in the sunny hustle and bustle of summer. 🌪
.
There's something about the shorter days that relieves the pressure that I always feel in the summer to go outside and be productive. I always feel antsy to go outside and do active things while the sun's out. But now that so much of the afternoon is being lost to darkness, I feel like it's the earth giving me a little nod and letting me know that staying inside is just fine, indeed. So here I sit, typing away furiously at my keyboard between long hard thinks. 🧠
.
This morning I'm getting all my ducks in a row for Thanksgiving prep, writing up an outline for next year's creative mastermind, and drafting a survey for last year's workshop participants. 📝 I'm *realllly* excited to hear what everyone would like to learn in the advanced workshop I'll be hosting next year. Yay!
.
As for this orange sweet, it's a tasty 'Spiced Baked Pumpkin' that's a cross between a very moist cake and pumpkin pie filling. It's a great option if you have any #glutenfree folks at the table. It's super dense, moist, and has the most delicious spiced autumn flavor. You can grab the recipe in the archives at AdventuresInCooking.com! 😊
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

.

Sharing the recipe for this classic apple pie with a hazelnut crust up on the blog today! You can peek at it via the link in profile ☝🏼 A few weeks back Jeremy and I went up to this area of Oregon known as the 'Fruit Loop' that has TONS of apple trees around, and we picked up some of the apples that went into this lovely pie! 🍎🍎🍎
.
We do have a big old apple tree in our backyard, but the apples from it are very tart (I think they're cider apples) and always a bit wormy so I usually just leave those on the ground for the chickens to enjoy. 🐔
.

The recipe for this tasty Pumpkin Pie with Butterscotch is up on the blog, and I highly recommend making it a part of your Thanksgiving table! The filling is made with silky @vermontcreamery creme fraiche, which adds the best velvety texture to the custard and the slightest hint of tang. #keepitfraiche #ad
.
There's also homemade butterscotch sauce incorporated both into the filling itself AND drizzled over the finished pie (YESSSS!), plus roasted pumpkin and a host of delicious autumnal spices.
.
In the post I also have my top tips for making the perfect pumpkin pie, including using a bain marie in the oven while baking to prevent cracks from forming and to keep the filling nice and moist! You can grab the recipe via the link in profile, enjoy it, friends!
.

.

.

A little autumn feast. These assorted squash + pumpkins are stuffed with a date + sausage cassoulet and roasted in the oven until tender and bubbling. 🍯
.
If you're unfamiliar with cassoulet, it's a French bean stew with a base of caramelized onions and sausage and tastes INSANELY good. It's *definitely* in my top-3 cold weather comfort foods 👌🏼
.
You can find the recipe in my cookbook, #FirstWeEat, via the link in my profile 👆🏼 And just a reminder that I'm co-hosting a @oursecretsupper today! Make sure to follow along in my Instagram stories for all the scenery + magic ✨ Happy autumn, friends!! 🧡🧡🧡

Spending today out at the property planting our very first tree. While there's thousands of douglas fir saplings out there, those were all put in the ground by the logging company who had the land before us, and this is the very first that we've planted there ourselves. 🏡
.
This year was me and Jeremy's 5-year wedding anniversary, and it's gift theme is "wood". I surprised Jeremy with a little baby Oregon oak tree with a ribbon tied around it back in September, and it's taken this long to get regular enough rain that we feel safe transplanting it outside.
.
I can't wait to watch it grow together as our lives grow, too. New branches, new growth, but always with deep, solid roots. I think this will be the first tree of many. 💚 What about you, have you planted a tree before? Do you have any favorite tree varieties that we should look into making a part of our forest home? 🌲🌳🌴
.
.
.
.
.
.

A little bit of pumpkin soup to remind you that it's still autumn and pumpkins taste AMAZING!! 😆
.
I got this recipe years and years ago when I was studying abroad in Germany in college. The recording arts teacher's wife made us students a big pot of this soup, and I loved it so much I asked for the recipe. 📝 She wrote it down in German, and my host mother translated it for me and that's how it got to the blog.
.
It's vegan and super hearty and filling, thanks to all those German potatoes + pumpkins in it, and really refreshing due to the hefty bit of ginger in it, too! Great for staying warm and cozy during the cold weather. You can find a link to the recipe in my insta stories and at AdventuresInCooking.com 🧡
.

.
Have a wonderful day, friends!!!! 🍁🎃🍂

It's time to VOTE!!!! A few months ago I made a borderline OCD excel spreadsheet with all the topics laid out that motivated me to vote and that I'd hope would motivate others to vote. In it I linked to source articles that talked about each point in more detail. It's pretty elaborate, and I'm linking to it in my profile today in case anyone still hasn't voted or made up their mind in their local elections (it's literally 99 rows long....brace yourself). ☝🏼
.
To be honest, reading through it both breaks my heart and enrages me. But, it also motivates me, which is a good thing. It makes me know in my heart that we can do better, and that the American people DESERVE better. Every one of us deserves to be treated with dignity and respect, whether we're born here, like I was, or come here in search of a better life, like my father did when he left Greece some 40+ years ago. When we cast our vote, we're demanding respect and creating a better tomorrow for ourselves, our fellow citizens, and for future Americans.⚖️
.
Fish rot from the head. So if you dislike Trump and his policies, don't look only to him. Look to the political forces, policies, and parties that enable him. Look to your local officials who are enacting his will in your local community. By voting, you DO make a difference. You make a difference in your town, your state, and your country.
.
Our world is at a turning point, and I truly believe that this is the single most important election to ever take place. There is SO MUCH at stake here; so many civil liberties that have taken hundreds of years to enact could be taken away with one foul, cheeto-stained swoop. It is our time to get the representatives in place who will keep that from happening. ✊🏽
.
Please, VOTE! And tell your friends and family to vote! And post about voting! And treat yourself for voting! But most importantly, vote like your life as you know it depends on it because IT DOES. 🇺🇸
.
.
#votetoday #voteblue #saynotofacism #fckyesimvoting #ivoted #ivoted🇺🇸

I’m helping you put all those roast turkey leftovers to use with this *crazy* delicious turkey tetrazzini pasta made with @BarillaUS fettuccine with sauteed mushrooms in an olive oil, white wine, and parmesan sauce topped with parsley + red chili breadcrumbs!
.
This recipe was inspired by the @BarillaUS #PastaWorldChampionship I attended last month in Italy (if you follow along with my Insta stories you got to see all the behind-the-scenes action!)
.
There were 18 chefs competing from all over the world, and they each had an hour to create a gourmet pasta dish in their respective rounds. The competition was fierce, but @ms_carolina_diaz of the US cinched the championship title with her incredibly flavorful + innovative dishes. She’s the first woman to ever win the #PastaWorldChampionship (girl represent!!) <3
.
I drew a *ton* of inspiration from her, and you can read + see all about the competition via the link in profile! ☝🏼 And don’t forget to bookmark this turkey tetrazzini recipe for the long holiday weekend!! #ad
.
.
.
.
.
.
